intro: Indigastrum costatum subsp. goniodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved indigastrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, ribbed stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
